title: How to Make Dog Jewelry

steps.headline: Cut a piece of elastic 2 in (5.1 cm) longer than your dog's neck circumference.
steps.description: Get a spool of durable jewelry-making elastic to string your beads onto. Measure your dog's neck with a soft tape measure to find its circumference. Then, add 2 in (5.1 cm) to the measurement and cut a piece of elastic to this length. For example, if your dog's neck circumference is 15 in (38 cm), and then add 2 in (5.1 cm) for a total of 17 in (43 cm). Don't stretch the elastic before you cut it. Keep it slack so that you don't end up with a piece that's too short.

steps.headline: String beads onto the elastic in the order you want.
steps.description: Choose any color and type of bead you want to make your dog's necklace! Insert the end of the elastic through a bead while holding onto the other end of the elastic. Repeat this until you have added the desired number of beads. You can create a pattern using different color beads, or string beads of the same color onto the elastic. For example, you could do an alternating pattern of pink and white beads, or create a rainbow colored strand with red, green, blue, yellow, green, purple, and orange. You could also add an accent bead to 1 or both ends of the elastic or to the center of the elastic. Choose a larger bead that has a different shape or design than the rest of the beads. Tip: Check to be sure that the beads will fit onto the elastic you have chosen. Hold the end of the elastic up to one of the beads to check.

steps.headline: Tie the ends of the elastic together to secure the beads.
steps.description: After you have the desired amount of beads on the elastic strand, hold the ends together so that the tips are even. Then, tie the ends of the elastic band together twice to form a knot. Position the knot about ⁄2 in (1.3 cm) from the tips of the strands. You may leave the excess elastic or cut the ends about ⁄4 in (0.64 cm) from the knot.

steps.headline: Slip the elastic beaded necklace over your dog's head.
steps.description: After you have finished stringing the beads and securing the elastic, your dog can wear the necklace! Slip it on over your dog's head and see how it looks. The necklace should be snug, but not tight on your dog's neck. Check to ensure that you can easily slide your hand under the beads while your dog is wearing the necklace. If the necklace is too tight, it may cause skin irritation and general discomfort.

steps.headline: Measure around your dog's neck to find its collar size.
steps.description: Use a soft measuring tape to measure around your dog's neck or measure your dog's collar from end to end. Then, add 3 in (7.6 cm) to this length. For example, if your dog's neck size or collar length is 12 in (30 cm), then adding 3 in (7.6 cm) would give you a total of 15 in (38 cm). Dog collar sizes vary greatly by breed, so taking your dog's collar measurement is your best option.

steps.headline: Cut a strip of ⁄4 in (1.9 cm) grosgrain ribbon.
steps.description: Grosgrain ribbon is a special type of ribbed or corded ribbon that works well as a base for a rhinestone dog necklace. You may use any color ribbon you like as a backdrop for the rhinestone trim. Use a sharp pair of scissors to cut the ribbon to the same length as your dog's collar size. For example, if your dog's collar size is 15 in (38 cm), then cut the ribbon to this length.

steps.headline: Trim the ends with pinking shears to remove any frayed edges.
steps.description: After you cut the ribbon to the required length, cut straight across about ⁄4 in (0.64 cm) away from each of the ends of the ribbon. This will help to prevent the ends from fraying. Pinking shears are scissors with jagged edged blades and they are available in craft supply stores.

steps.headline: Fold and stitch the ends in place using a sewing machine.
steps.description: Fold 1 in (2.5 cm) of the ribbon underneath itself at 1 end. Then, place the end under your sewing machine needle, or thread a needle with matching thread. Sew across the end about ⁄4 in (0.64 cm) from the fold. Repeat this for the other end of the ribbon. If you are using a sewing machine, set it to the straight stitch setting and sew across the folded ribbon 1 time. Cut the excess thread when you reach the end. If you are using a needle and thread, tie a knot in the end of the thread, then sew through the ribbon on 1 side and out the other side about ⁄4 in (0.64 cm) from where you inserted the needle. Repeat the stitch all the way across the ribbon to secure the fold and then tie off and cut the excess thread.

steps.headline: Cut 1 piece each of of rhinestone dangle and rhinestone trim.
steps.description: Rhinestone dangle has pieces hanging from the edges, while trim is a straight strip of rhinestones. You may use any type of rhinestone dangle trim and straight trim you like. Make sure that the trim has a fabric edge that you can sew onto your ribbon. Measure the new length of the grosgrain ribbon. Then, cut the dangle and trim 1 in (2.5 cm) shorter than the ribbon length. For example, if the ribbon measures 18 in (46 cm), then cut the dangle and trim to 17 in (43 cm) each. You can purchase dangle and straight rhinestone trim in a craft supply store. It may be sold in a precut spool or you may be able to buy the exact length you need. Find your dog's collar size before you buy it so you will know approximately how much to buy.

steps.headline: Sew the rhinestone dangle trim to the ribbon.
steps.description: Use a sewing machine to stitch the dangle trim to the bottom edge of the ribbon. Set the sewing machine to the straight stitch setting. Position the dangle trim along the bottom edge of the ribbon, and then sew along the bottom edge of the ribbon and top edge of the dangle trim to secure them together. The bottom of the ribbon can be either side you want it to be at this point.

steps.headline: Attach the trim to the center of the ribbon with a needle and thread.
steps.description: Thread a needle with a 18 in (46 cm) of a matching color of thread and tie a knot in the end of the thread. Then, insert the needle in through the back side of the ribbon near 1 end and bring it back out through the rhinestone trim on the other side. Then, insert the needle in through the rhinestone trim on the same side, back through the ribbon, and out on the other side. Continue sewing in and out of the ribbon and trim until you reach the end. Then, tie off the thread and cut the excess.

steps.headline: Sew two ⁄8 in (0.95 cm) snaps to opposite ends of the ribbon.
steps.description: Use a needle and thread to stitch the socket ends of the snaps onto one end of the ribbon. Sew the socket end of the snap over the spot where you hemmed the end of the ribbon. Stitch the ball ends on the reverse side of the other end so that it will match up with the socket end. After you finish attaching the snaps, your dog's rhinestone necklace is ready to wear. Try it on your dog and see how it looks! Tip: Make sure the necklace isn't too tight on your dog or it may cause irritation or even pose a strangulation hazard. You should be able to easily fit 2 fingers under the ribbon.

text: Stringing a Beaded Dog Necklace Cut a piece of elastic 2 in (5.1 cm) longer than your dog's neck circumference. Get a spool of durable jewelry-making elastic to string your beads onto. Measure your dog's neck with a soft tape measure to find its circumference. Then, add 2 in (5.1 cm) to the measurement and cut a piece of elastic to this length. For example, if your dog's neck circumference is 15 in (38 cm), and then add 2 in (5.1 cm) for a total of 17 in (43 cm). Don't stretch the elastic before you cut it. Keep it slack so that you don't end up with a piece that's too short. String beads onto the elastic in the order you want. Choose any color and type of bead you want to make your dog's necklace! Insert the end of the elastic through a bead while holding onto the other end of the elastic. Repeat this until you have added the desired number of beads. You can create a pattern using different color beads, or string beads of the same color onto the elastic. For example, you could do an alternating pattern of pink and white beads, or create a rainbow colored strand with red, green, blue, yellow, green, purple, and orange. You could also add an accent bead to 1 or both ends of the elastic or to the center of the elastic. Choose a larger bead that has a different shape or design than the rest of the beads. Tip: Check to be sure that the beads will fit onto the elastic you have chosen. Hold the end of the elastic up to one of the beads to check. Tie the ends of the elastic together to secure the beads. After you have the desired amount of beads on the elastic strand, hold the ends together so that the tips are even. Then, tie the ends of the elastic band together twice to form a knot. Position the knot about ⁄2 in (1.3 cm) from the tips of the strands. You may leave the excess elastic or cut the ends about ⁄4 in (0.64 cm) from the knot. Slip the elastic beaded necklace over your dog's head. After you have finished stringing the beads and securing the elastic, your dog can wear the necklace! Slip it on over your dog's head and see how it looks. The necklace should be snug, but not tight on your dog's neck. Check to ensure that you can easily slide your hand under the beads while your dog is wearing the necklace. If the necklace is too tight, it may cause skin irritation and general discomfort. Then, add 3 in (7.6 cm) to this length. For example, if your dog's neck size or collar length is 12 in (30 cm), then adding 3 in (7.6 cm) would give you a total of 15 in (38 cm). Dog collar sizes vary greatly by breed, so taking your dog's collar measurement is your best option. Cut a strip of ⁄4 in (1.9 cm) grosgrain ribbon. Grosgrain ribbon is a special type of ribbed or corded ribbon that works well as a base for a rhinestone dog necklace. You may use any color ribbon you like as a backdrop for the rhinestone trim. Use a sharp pair of scissors to cut the ribbon to the same length as your dog's collar size. For example, if your dog's collar size is 15 in (38 cm), then cut the ribbon to this length. Trim the ends with pinking shears to remove any frayed edges. After you cut the ribbon to the required length, cut straight across about ⁄4 in (0.64 cm) away from each of the ends of the ribbon. This will help to prevent the ends from fraying. Pinking shears are scissors with jagged edged blades and they are available in craft supply stores. Fold and stitch the ends in place using a sewing machine. Fold 1 in (2.5 cm) of the ribbon underneath itself at 1 end. Then, place the end under your sewing machine needle, or thread a needle with matching thread. Sew across the end about ⁄4 in (0.64 cm) from the fold. Repeat this for the other end of the ribbon. If you are using a sewing machine, set it to the straight stitch setting and sew across the folded ribbon 1 time. Cut the excess thread when you reach the end. If you are using a needle and thread, tie a knot in the end of the thread, then sew through the ribbon on 1 side and out the other side about ⁄4 in (0.64 cm) from where you inserted the needle. Repeat the stitch all the way across the ribbon to secure the fold and then tie off and cut the excess thread. Cut 1 piece each of of rhinestone dangle and rhinestone trim. Rhinestone dangle has pieces hanging from the edges, while trim is a straight strip of rhinestones. You may use any type of rhinestone dangle trim and straight trim you like. Make sure that the trim has a fabric edge that you can sew onto your ribbon. Measure the new length of the grosgrain ribbon. Then, cut the dangle and trim 1 in (2.5 cm) shorter than the ribbon length. For example, if the ribbon measures 18 in (46 cm), then cut the dangle and trim to 17 in (43 cm) each. You can purchase dangle and straight rhinestone trim in a craft supply store. It may be sold in a precut spool or you may be able to buy the exact length you need. Find your dog's collar size before you buy it so you will know approximately how much to buy. Sew the rhinestone dangle trim to the ribbon. Use a sewing machine to stitch the dangle trim to the bottom edge of the ribbon. Set the sewing machine to the straight stitch setting. Position the dangle trim along the bottom edge of the ribbon, and then sew along the bottom edge of the ribbon and top edge of the dangle trim to secure them together. The bottom of the ribbon can be either side you want it to be at this point. Attach the trim to the center of the ribbon with a needle and thread. Thread a needle with a 18 in (46 cm) of a matching color of thread and tie a knot in the end of the thread. Then, insert the needle in through the back side of the ribbon near 1 end and bring it back out through the rhinestone trim on the other side. Then, insert the needle in through the rhinestone trim on the same side, back through the ribbon, and out on the other side. Continue sewing in and out of the ribbon and trim until you reach the end. Then, tie off the thread and cut the excess. Sew two ⁄8 in (0.95 cm) snaps to opposite ends of the ribbon. Use a needle and thread to stitch the socket ends of the snaps onto one end of the ribbon. Sew the socket end of the snap over the spot where you hemmed the end of the ribbon. Stitch the ball ends on the reverse side of the other end so that it will match up with the socket end. After you finish attaching the snaps, your dog's rhinestone necklace is ready to wear. Try it on your dog and see how it looks! Tip: Make sure the necklace isn't too tight on your dog or it may cause irritation or even pose a strangulation hazard. You should be able to easily fit 2 fingers under the ribbon.
sentences: Stringing a Beaded Dog Necklace Cut a piece of elastic 2 in (5.1 cm) longer than your dog's neck circumference.
Get a spool of durable jewelry-making elastic to string your beads onto.
Measure your dog's neck with a soft tape measure to find its circumference.
Then, add 2 in (5.1 cm) to the measurement and cut a piece of elastic to this length.
For example, if your dog's neck circumference is 15 in (38 cm), and then add 2 in (5.1 cm) for a total of 17 in (43 cm).
Don't stretch the elastic before you cut it.
Keep it slack so that you don't end up with a piece that's too short.
String beads onto the elastic in the order you want.
Choose any color and type of bead you want to make your dog's necklace!
Insert the end of the elastic through a bead while holding onto the other end of the elastic.
Repeat this until you have added the desired number of beads.
You can create a pattern using different color beads, or string beads of the same color onto the elastic.
For example, you could do an alternating pattern of pink and white beads, or create a rainbow colored strand with red, green, blue, yellow, green, purple, and orange.
You could also add an accent bead to 1 or both ends of the elastic or to the center of the elastic.
Choose a larger bead that has a different shape or design than the rest of the beads.
Tip: Check to be sure that the beads will fit onto the elastic you have chosen.
Hold the end of the elastic up to one of the beads to check.
Tie the ends of the elastic together to secure the beads.
After you have the desired amount of beads on the elastic strand, hold the ends together so that the tips are even.
Then, tie the ends of the elastic band together twice to form a knot.
Position the knot about ⁄2 in (1.3 cm) from the tips of the strands.
You may leave the excess elastic or cut the ends about ⁄4 in (0.64 cm) from the knot.
Slip the elastic beaded necklace over your dog's head.
After you have finished stringing the beads and securing the elastic, your dog can wear the necklace!
Slip it on over your dog's head and see how it looks.
The necklace should be snug, but not tight on your dog's neck.
Check to ensure that you can easily slide your hand under the beads while your dog is wearing the necklace.
If the necklace is too tight, it may cause skin irritation and general discomfort.
Making a Rhinestone Necklace Measure around your dog's neck to find its collar size.
Use a soft measuring tape to measure around your dog's neck or measure your dog's collar from end to end.
Then, add 3 in (7.6 cm) to this length.
For example, if your dog's neck size or collar length is 12 in (30 cm), then adding 3 in (7.6 cm) would give you a total of 15 in (38 cm).
Dog collar sizes vary greatly by breed, so taking your dog's collar measurement is your best option.
Cut a strip of ⁄4 in (1.9 cm) grosgrain ribbon.
Grosgrain ribbon is a special type of ribbed or corded ribbon that works well as a base for a rhinestone dog necklace.
You may use any color ribbon you like as a backdrop for the rhinestone trim.
Use a sharp pair of scissors to cut the ribbon to the same length as your dog's collar size.
For example, if your dog's collar size is 15 in (38 cm), then cut the ribbon to this length.
Trim the ends with pinking shears to remove any frayed edges.
After you cut the ribbon to the required length, cut straight across about ⁄4 in (0.64 cm) away from each of the ends of the ribbon.
This will help to prevent the ends from fraying.
Pinking shears are scissors with jagged edged blades and they are available in craft supply stores.
Fold and stitch the ends in place using a sewing machine.
Fold 1 in (2.5 cm) of the ribbon underneath itself at 1 end.
Then, place the end under your sewing machine needle, or thread a needle with matching thread.
Sew across the end about ⁄4 in (0.64 cm) from the fold.
Repeat this for the other end of the ribbon.
If you are using a sewing machine, set it to the straight stitch setting and sew across the folded ribbon 1 time.
Cut the excess thread when you reach the end.
If you are using a needle and thread, tie a knot in the end of the thread, then sew through the ribbon on 1 side and out the other side about ⁄4 in (0.64 cm) from where you inserted the needle.
Repeat the stitch all the way across the ribbon to secure the fold and then tie off and cut the excess thread.
Cut 1 piece each of of rhinestone dangle and rhinestone trim.
Rhinestone dangle has pieces hanging from the edges, while trim is a straight strip of rhinestones.
You may use any type of rhinestone dangle trim and straight trim you like.
Make sure that the trim has a fabric edge that you can sew onto your ribbon.
Measure the new length of the grosgrain ribbon.
Then, cut the dangle and trim 1 in (2.5 cm) shorter than the ribbon length.
For example, if the ribbon measures 18 in (46 cm), then cut the dangle and trim to 17 in (43 cm) each.
You can purchase dangle and straight rhinestone trim in a craft supply store.
It may be sold in a precut spool or you may be able to buy the exact length you need.
Find your dog's collar size before you buy it so you will know approximately how much to buy.
Sew the rhinestone dangle trim to the ribbon.
Use a sewing machine to stitch the dangle trim to the bottom edge of the ribbon.
Set the sewing machine to the straight stitch setting.
Position the dangle trim along the bottom edge of the ribbon, and then sew along the bottom edge of the ribbon and top edge of the dangle trim to secure them together.
The bottom of the ribbon can be either side you want it to be at this point.
Attach the trim to the center of the ribbon with a needle and thread.
Thread a needle with a 18 in (46 cm) of a matching color of thread and tie a knot in the end of the thread.
Then, insert the needle in through the back side of the ribbon near 1 end and bring it back out through the rhinestone trim on the other side.
Then, insert the needle in through the rhinestone trim on the same side, back through the ribbon, and out on the other side.
Continue sewing in and out of the ribbon and trim until you reach the end.
Then, tie off the thread and cut the excess.
Sew two ⁄8 in (0.95 cm) snaps to opposite ends of the ribbon.
Use a needle and thread to stitch the socket ends of the snaps onto one end of the ribbon.
Sew the socket end of the snap over the spot where you hemmed the end of the ribbon.
Stitch the ball ends on the reverse side of the other end so that it will match up with the socket end.
After you finish attaching the snaps, your dog's rhinestone necklace is ready to wear.
Try it on your dog and see how it looks!
Tip: Make sure the necklace isn't too tight on your dog or it may cause irritation or even pose a strangulation hazard.
You should be able to easily fit 2 fingers under the ribbon.
